messages.message: alrighty im starting the cplane provisioner job (https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/control-plane-sandbox-provisioner/4673/) for the doc-insights sandbox with experimental control plane set
ok i have some problems, Iâ€™ll resolve it with you privately @mfichman and post updates on this thread

OK, so it seems like even with Experimental Control Plane checked, the core patch for the `job-dbmigrate` job was not applied. That patch includes the DB credentials, so :fail_stamp:

What we ended up doing was:

```aws eks update-kubeconfig --name=YOUR-SANDBOX --region=us-east-2 --profile=ib-sandbox-user

kubectl -n instabase get job/job-dbmigrate -o yaml > dbmigrate.yml
kubectl -n instabase get deployment/deployment-core-platform-service -o yaml

**Edit dbmigrate.yml to add INSTABASE_BACKEND_DB_PARAMS, copied from core-platform-service**

kubectl -n instabase delete job/job-dbmigrate
kubectl -n instabase apply -f dbmigrate.yml```
Another option -- if you still have access to the CP UI at  `/control-plane`, you can patch `job-dbmigrate` to add `INSTABASE_BACKEND_DB_PARAMS` (copy from `core-platform-service`)
